column1: Prediabetes occurs when the level of sugar (glucose) in your blood is too high, but not high enough to be called diabetes.
Your body gets energy from the glucose in your blood.
A hormone called insulin helps the cells in your body use glucose.
This is because high glucose levels in the blood can damage the blood vessels and nerves.
If you have prediabetes, damage may already be occurring in your blood vessels.
Take medicines as directed: Depending on your other risk factors, your provider may prescribe medicines to lower cholesterol or blood pressure or to help prevent diabetes.
